title: Online Instructional Design Workshop for Social Studies Using BaGua-Based Creative Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social studies knowledge and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: A course focused on strengthening creative instructional design competencies even in physically isolated environments post-COVID-19, aiming to cultivate real-time interaction and social problem-solving skills using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three creative problem-solving strategies using the Yin-Yang interaction of the BaGua model.
Learners can design an instructional plan integrating a BaGua-based approach into the Dick and Carey model phases.
Learners can develop one creative lesson scenario for addressing social issues in an online environment and receive peer feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
